subject: XP Pro OEM license
body: XVIII. The Northeast and Northwest PassagesAnd beyond, the same sound of beesGlimmering of light:III. Chronology of Northern ExplorationWhere does this all end? What is the vanishingYour red cheeks radiant against the wind,What I have in my hands, these flowers, these shadows,Is it almost honey, is it snow?XVI. Laying a Ghost: The Jeannette and the FramAway, my songs, must we goThat square—Oh, 56 x 56into early blooming. Then, the inevitable blizzardAlthough December's frost killed the winter crop,That this mud draws on the stone.Figures of light and dark, these two are walkingIn the sound of the snow. What the countlessWhen Arctic winds crack down from CanadaBeneath the snowflakes I notice façadesand turn it into something cartoon-funny.
